result.execSummary:
The defendant Ariel M. Glodowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

Huber privileges are granted for work and schoolt and any other reason jail will alllow pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. Report today to set up start date. To be served within 60 days.
Concurrent with: with 15CF173 consecutive to 15CM65.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Ariel M. Glodowski
Current: 6581 Oak Drive, Amherst, WI 54406 United States  (Effective: 09-26-2017)
Prior: 270 Shannon Ct Apt 1, Plover, WI 54467 United States

Defendant Ariel M. Glodowski in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CF56, 15CF173, and 15CM65 are heard today.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
15CF173 Ct 2: 5 days jail, concurrent with 15CF56, but consecutive to 15CM65, Pay costs + DNA surcharge.
15CM65 Ct 1: 5 days jail, fine, $26.45 blood draw, 12 mo rev & IID
15CM65 Ct 3: $100 fine + costs with zero days suspension and zero days jail
15CF56 Ct 1: 5 days jail, consecutive with 15CM65. Pay costs.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a pleas of: 
15CM65 Ct 1: No Contest
15CM65 Ct 3: No Contest
15CF56 Ct 1:  No Contest
15CF173 Ct 2: No Contest
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF173 Ct 2, 15CM65 Ct 1, 15CM65 Ct 3, & 15CF56 Ct 1:.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 15CF56 counts 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 15CM65 ct 4, and 15CF173 Ct 1 are Dismissed and Read In. 15CM65 Ct 2 is Dismissed.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland concurs with joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:****

15CM65 Ct 1: OWI 2nd: 
5 days jail, w/Huber for work and school and any other reason jail will allow. Report today to set up start date. To be served within 60 days.
$1,379.00 fine, 60 days to pay or set up payment plan
$26.45 blood draw, 
12 mo revocation of license 
12 mo IID, upon reinstatement of license

15CM65 Ct 3: OAR:
$100 fine + costs, 60 days to pay or set up payment plan
zero days suspension and zero days jail

15CF56 Ct 1: Disorderly Conduct: 
5 days jail, concurrent with 15CF173 consecutive to 15CM65. w/Huber for work and school and any other reason jail will allowReport today to set up start date. To be served within 60 days. 1 day credit
Pay costs. 60 days to pay or set up payment plan

15CF173 Ct 2: Bail Jump: 
5 days jail, concurrent with 15CF56, but consecutive to 15CM65, w/Huber for work and school and any other reason jail will allow. Report today to set up start date, 1 day jail credit. To be served within 60 days.
 Pay costs + DNA surcharge. 60 days to pay or set up payment plan
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Ariel M. Glodowski in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Order for Granted Bond modifications stated on the record on 04-10-15 by Judge Eagon. /s/DW
